title: Qantas and Singapore make rankings for first, business, premium and economy class, but where are the U.S. carriers?
text:
CNN Leadership
AirlineRatings.com names best inflight experiences for 2015 Updated 0922 GMT (1622 HKT) October 8, 2015 12 photos: And the airline offering the best inflight service is... First class: Emirates – AirlineRatings.com has announced its 2015 rankings for inflight services. Emirates is among the top three first class providers. AirlineRatings.com says: "Emirates' first class is modeled on the Orient Express. The railway carriage style cabins drip opulence with service to match. And the airline was the first to offer showers to its first class passengers on the flagship A380. First class passengers can stay cocooned in their private world or seek some company at the lounge bar at the rear of the upper deck." Hide Caption 1 of 12 12 photos: And the airline offering the best inflight service is... First class: SIngapore – AirlineRatings.com says: "The airline has been a trendsetter right across the passenger cabin since its launch in 1972. In 2007 it introduced a new standard of first class with its A380 offering a double bed, although it had to quickly stress that passengers were not allowed to get too intimate. But the surroundings are very intimate not to mention opulent." Hide Caption 2 of 12 12 photos: And the airline offering the best inflight service is... First class: Etihad – AirlineRatings.com says: "Last year Etihad reinvented its premium cabins initially for its long haul A380s and 787s and will upgrade its 777s. Its first class on its flagship A380 is quite simply in a class of its own with space, space and more space. The airline also added a lobby lounge for both first and business class. First class passengers can also use a dedicated shower." Hide Caption 3 of 12 12 photos: And the airline offering the best inflight service is... Business class: Air New Zealand – AirlineRatings.com says: "The airline's Business Premier is the equivalent of many airlines' first class. The airline has gone to a great deal of trouble with its mattress which is super comfortable ensuring a good night's rest. The beverage and food service is just superb." Hide Caption 4 of 12 12 photos: And the airline offering the best inflight service is... Business class: Qantas – AirlineRatings.com says: "The Australian airline invented business class in 1979 and has constantly updated its product since, both in the air and on the ground, where it boasts the world's best business lounges. The airline is currently rolling out a new business suite on its medium to long range A330s." Hide Caption 5 of 12 12 photos: And the airline offering the best inflight service is... Business class: Etihad – AirlineRatings.com says: "Its new business product for the A380 and 787 raises the bar for the rest of the industry. Business class passengers can avail themselves of a lobby lounge on the top deck of the A380. Service levels are excellent and the menu outstanding." Hide Caption 6 of 12 12 photos: And the airline offering the best inflight service is... Premium economy: Air New Zealand – AirlineRatings.com says: "Put simply, Air New Zealand's premium economy is like business, just without the bed. From hot towels, a warm duvet, noise canceling headphones, full amenity kit, complete bar offering and business class quality meals and snacks served on a linen tablecloth, it is value and comfort at its best." Hide Caption 7 of 12 12 photos: And the airline offering the best inflight service is... Premium economy: British Airways – AirlineRatings.com says: "The airline was one of the first adopters of premium economy and has continued to refine and update its offering. With plenty of personal space and storage options for passengers the product is very similar to what business class used to be." Hide Caption 8 of 12 12 photos: And the airline offering the best inflight service is... Premium economy: Qantas – AirlineRatings.com says: "Available on the longest flights in the world and offering exceptional seat comfort and space, Qantas's premium economy is something to be tried. In addition to the seat comfort, passengers are provided with thick blankets, business class style catering, noise canceling headphones and a great selection of inflight entertainment." Hide Caption 9 of 12 12 photos: And the airline offering the best inflight service is... Economy class: Air New Zealand – AirlineRatings.com says: "This is one airline that hasn't forgotten where most of its passengers fly. Who else serves their passengers fruit salad and scones with jam and cream for an afternoon tea snack?" They are also behind the popular and unique Skycouch -- a section of the cabin in economy where seat groupings of three transform into a couch, giving passengers traveling together more options to lie flat or recline. Hide Caption 10 of 12 12 photos: And the airline offering the best inflight service is... Economy class: Etihad – AirlineRatings.com says: "Offering three main course choices and hot desserts, the airline takes economy to the next level. With Wi-Fi rolled out across almost the entire fleet, the interactive E-box inflight entrainment system, a generous seat pitch of 32-34 inches and inflight nannies on select flights to keep children entertained, the airline does all it can to make the flight enjoyable." Hide Caption 11 of 12 12 photos: And the airline offering the best inflight service is... Economy class: Singapore Airlines – AirlineRatings.com says: "Since the days of economy class travel, Singapore Airlines has always set the benchmark high. From generous sized meals, comprehensive inflight entertainment, self-serve snack bars, generously padded seats with optional lumbar support, footrests and large warm blankets, this airline continues to be one of our favorites."
